_header: Honoured be Thou blissful Lord Jesu
Title(s): Pèlerinage de l’âme; The Angels’ Second Song within Heaven
_description: Thomas Hoccleve, The Angels’ Second Song within Heaven, in the English translation of the Pèlerinage de l’âme — five stanzas rhyme royal

Bod770.First Lines:
Honurid be þou blisful lord ihesuand perisid mot þou be
                    in euery place…
Bod770.Last Lines:
…þat doon here deuoir as þei mai & cannow
                    þaukid be þou ihesu god & may

OxfCCC237.First Lines:
Honoured be þu blissefull lord IhesuAnd preysed be þu
                    moste in euery place…
OxfCCC237.Last Lines:
…That done her devoyr as þei may & kanNow þankyd
                    be þu Ihesu god & man
OxfCCC237.Attributed Title: The Aungelles songe with inne heuen (f. 49v)

CamGon124.First Lines:
hOnoured be þu blisful lord JhesuAnd preysed mostow ben in
                    euery place…
CamGon124.Last Lines:
…þat don þeire deuoyre as þai may &
                    canThonkyd be þu Ihesu god & man

CULKk17.Transcription:
…That don þeir deuoyr as þei may canThankyd be
                    þou Jhesu god and man
CULKk17.Attributed Title:
her endith þe drem of þe pilgrimage of þe soule (f.
                        124v)

BLAdd34193.First Lines:
Honourede be þou blistefull lorde ihesu and preseide mot
                    þou be…
BLAdd34193.Last Lines:
…þat do þair dener os þai may and canNow
                    thankede be þou ihesu gode and man

BLAdd37049.Editions:
Doty,  Brant Lee,
                        ed.  
             “An Edition of British Museum MS Additional 37049: a Religious
                Miscellany.” 
         Diss. Michigan State, 1969: 414-16.

BLEge615.First Lines: Honured be thu blisful lord IhuAnd preysed mote thu be in eueri place…
BLEge615.Last Lines: …That done hire devoire as thei may & kanThanked be the Ihu god and man

Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             “Hoccleve’s Works: The Regement of Princes and fourteen minor
                poems.” 
             EETS

NYPLSpenc19.First Lines:
Honured be thow blisful lord IhesuAnd preysed mote thow be in euery
                    place…
NYPLSpenc19.Last Lines:
…That don hir deuour as thei may & canThanked be thow
                    Ihesu god and man
